headline: Chinese cities are facing the financial abyss of their subway systems
subhead: After high-speed rail, subway lines are now dragging the cities they serve into huge levels of debt. This is due to colossal construction and operating costs, minimal revenues and a toxic relationship with real estate developers.

headline: Wolfgang Tillmans' photography in action
subhead: Ever since his start in the 1980s, the world-renowned German visual artist has explored every genre of photography. As the Centre Pompidou in Paris prepares to close for five years for major renovations, his abundant work has taken over the Public Information Library (Bpi).

headline: How Trump broke with his strategic allies to side with Russia over Ukraine
subhead: 'The Transatlantic Divorce' (5/5). After Barack Obama stepped back during the 2014 annexation of Crimea and Joe Biden hesitated, Donald Trump, now back in the White House, aligned himself with Russia at the UN and left his strategic allies alone to face Vladimir Putin.

headline: Limiting global warming to 1.5Â°C is now impossible
subhead: According to a group of scientists, the target set by the 2015 Paris Agreement can no longer be met due to the inability of countries to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

headline: Why Paris's Centre Pompidou, not even 50 years old, must close for five years
subhead: The building designed by Renzo Piano and Richard Rogers is set to undergo major renovations until 2030 in order to reduce its energy consumption by 40%. Since its opening in 1977, the space has been in constant transformation.
